thread.title: Walker finds decomposed body of mum missing for eight months under log in dense bushland - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Walker finds decomposed body of mum missing for eight months under log in dense bushland - Mirror Online

author: Danya Bazaraa
title: Walker finds decomposed body of mum missing for eight months under log in dense bushland - Mirror Online
text:
News Walker finds decomposed body of mum missing for eight months under log in dense bushland Forensic testing was carried out to identify the body, which was discovered 32 miles from where Karen Ristevski was last seen Share Human remains found yesterday are that of Melbourne woman Karen Ristevski, police have confirmed (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A walker has discovered the decomposed body of a mum who had been missing for eight months under a log in dense woodland. 
Karen Ristevski, 47, was found dead on a dirt track at Mount Macedon, about 40 miles north of Melbourne, Australia, leaving police with more questions than answers in the chilling case. 
Her family have said they are devastated over the loss of a "generous and loving person" and have vowed to do everything they can to help police find the person responsible, reports news.com.au 
Karen's cousin Lisa Gray said: “Karen was such a beautiful, kind, generous and loving person. 
"I would like to thank the police, the SES and everyone else who has helped us through this time." The body of Karen Ristevski was found by a passer-by in dense bushland (Photo: Facebook) The site where the body was found on Monday 
In a statement released by Victoria Police today, a spokesperson said: “Police can confirm the human remains found at Mount Macedon yesterday are that of missing Avondale Heights woman Karen Ristevski." 
Forensic testing was carried out to identify the body, which was found 52km from where Karen was last seen. 
A passer-by reportedly stumbled across the body under a log, the Herald Sun reports. Read More 
The lead-up to her death remains a mystery, as well as why her body was found in the park, less than 30km north of Toolern Vale, where a two-day search was carried out a couple of months ago. Badly decomposed body of missing mum Karen Ristevski found wedged under log eight months after she vanished Detectives are investigating the mysterious case of a missing woman found dead eight months after vanishing (Photo: Facebook) 
The SES had also spent months searching in bushland and waterways in the area, and in December last year police drained dams and searched the countryside south of where the body has now been discovered. 
Karen's widower Borce Ristevski had said his wife left their $1.1 million home in Avondale Heights, in Melbourne’s north west, on June 29, 2016, to clear her head, but she never returned. 
Police would like to speak to anyone that may have seen anything suspicious in the area. Read More Fears for missing Iraq war veteran suffering from PTSD who vanished on trip to Edinburgh 
They said: “Missing Persons Squad detectives are appealing for anyone that may have been walking along the dirt track off Loch Road or anyone that may have seen any vehicles to contact them." 
Detectives are also hoping to speak to anyone that may have been at Mount Macedon any time from June last year, who may have taken photos or videos in the area. Like us on Facebook
